Explore the Magnificent Art through Golden Triangle tour

Magnificent art and construction is the one thing which attracts every type of tourists having any interest. Tourists are bind to come, visit and explore the wonderful architecture if the construction is of world class level. You can find the one of this type in North India. North India architecture and art is known for its charm, attraction and fascination through out the world. Moreover, North India is so big to travel in one chance or in a limited span of time, so, to explore the North India in a well organized way, one should visit in an organized way and this organized scheme of touring North India is known as Golden Triangle Tour. The three main cities of North India which are covered under Golden Triangle Tour are Delhi, Jaipur and Agra.

Delhi is the capital of this big country. Delhi has a prosperous past from the time of Mahabharta. At that time, Delhi was known as Indraprastha and was the capital of Bharat which is now politically known as India. Golden Triangle Tour's first destination is Delhi. Here one can visit, Humayun's Tomb, Red Fort, Jama Masjid, Purana Quila, Qutub Minar, India Gate, Rashtrapati Bhawan, Parliament House, Raj Ghat, Vijaya Ghat, Lotus Temple, Akshardham Temple, Chatarpur Temple, Iskon Temple, Buddha Garden, Lodhi Garden etc. Here you will also find the enchanting avenues of shopping with modernity for every age and size. Delhi has world's latest variety, style and fashion. The famous markets in Delhi are Sarojni Nagar Market, Lajpat Nagar Market, Kamla Nagar Market, and Karol Bagh Market etc. Apart from that you will also find luxurious shopping malls here which will definitely have top most brands for you. Delhi has everything to offer to its tourists of any taste.

The second halt of Golden Triangle Tour is Jaipur which is known as The Pink City. Jaipur is basically famous for its world class heritage and architecture only. The historical monuments here so beautifully designed that tourists are attracted towards the beauty of this art. And on top of that, each and every building is made by Pink Stone which enhances its beauty to hundred times. The places to be seen here are Jantar Mantar, City Palace, Nahargarh Fort, Amber Fort, Jal Mahal, Hawa Mahal, Sheesh Mahal, Birla Mandir, beautiful gardens and culturally rich shopping centers where you can buy cultural stuffs which are hand made. Jaipur’s handicraft is famous world wide.

Third place left in your tour is Agra and we all know that Agra is globally famous for Taj Mahal. It is considered as UNESCO World Heritage. This magnificently designed white marbled structure was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan for his beautiful and loving wife Mumtaz Mahal. The other structures to be watched here are Fatehpur Sikri, Agra Fort, Itmad-Ud-Daullah's Tomb, Rambagh, Dayal Bagh and Sikandra. These monuments are also known for their wonderful architecture. Tourists are pleased when they explore such art with their eyes.

This circuit is the most famous and most preferred tourist circuit of North India where one can enjoy the beauty and versatility of these monuments as these cities has preserved their beauty from the time since they were designed. If somebody wants to explore the rich architectural heritage of India, one must visit it through Golden Triangle Tour.

The Marvelous Goa Tour with Pleasant Beaches, Carnival and L

Goa is a gorgeous state in western part of the country India. The state is the foremost tourist attraction for people from all over the world. Panaji is the capital city of the state, situated on the banks of river Mandovi. Goa provides warm hospitality to almost millions of travelers every year. Goa is one of the smallest states in India and has an area of about 3700 square kilometers. The city of Goa has a Portuguese outlook and so you will find a fusion of both India and Europe in its way of life. Goa is situated in the Western Ghats and Arabian Sea forms its western coast. Because of this fact Goa has rich vegetation and fauna and incredible beautiful and composed beaches.

Goa has famous Wildlife sanctuaries and National Parks such as Bondla Wildlife Sanctuary, Molem Wildlife Sanctuary, Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuary, Madei Wildlife Sanctuary, Netravali Wildlife Sanctuary, Mahaveer Wildlife Sanctuary and on the island of Chorao you will find the Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary. Animals such as Foxes, wild boars and birds from other countries are found in the forest.

No doubt that beach of Goa is the major tourist attraction and is known for its mind blowing celebrations and festivals. One can also enjoy doing shopping on the beaches of Goa. Some of the famous beaches in Goa are Anjuna beach where all night parties are celebrated, Baga beach, Dona Paula beach, Calangute beach, Candolin beach and Colva beach. One can also undertake motorboat racing in the beaches of Goa. Other trendy beach sports include swimming, volleyball, and angling, fishing and snorkeling.

The Carnival of Goa is celebrated in the month of February and is a foremost tourist attraction. Goa Carnival is all about celebrating with food and drinks and meeting near and dear ones. It’s one of the joyous event held in Goa. The Carnival of the city begins with huge processions, music and danc, people participating in the parade are stunningly dressed. Other individuals are also colorfully dressed. The Carnival is a sight of complete enjoyment and fun. The ending of Carnival is carried out by the performance of dance known as the Red and Black dance.

Goa is well known for its churches which has the Portuguese architecture and primeval temples such as the Shanta Durga Temple, the Mangueshi Temple and the Mahalasa Temple. The Bom Jesus Basilica is the World Heritage site in Goa and it has the earthly remnants of St. Francis Xavier. After every twelve years the carcass is taken out for worship and for community to see.

The city of Goa has majestic forts some of them are Tiracol, Aguada, Chapora and Cabo de Rama. The city also has a small number of museums. The Goa State Museum and the Naval Aviation Museum are the imperative ones. Feni is the most accepted alcoholic drink in the city and is prepared from the fruit of the cashew tree.

There are five-star as well as reasonable hotels, guest houses and lodges one can select from during the Goa tour. It is pleasant to take accommodation near the beach, so that one can enjoy the tranquil and fine-looking sight of the sea.

Important Guidelines to Consider while Travelling India

India is a country of great tourist attraction. For this almost millions of tourist from all over the universe travel to India. There are different tours available in India one chooses accordingly. As a result it becomes important for an individual to decide before hand which tour he would like to undertake when there are so many options in front of him. Once you are here in India you will be welcomed with kindness and generosity. Before planning any trip it is essential that to keep in mind certain important tips if one wants to make vacation in India a success story.

First of all it is important to plan your trip with the help of an Indian tour operator to have a serene and an unforgettable travel. India is a gigantic country where you will find many places of fame and tourist attraction. Therefore it is vital for one need to decide over the funds one is wishing to spend on the travel. For this reason it is required to consult your travel agent before hand in order to avoid unnecessary expenditure. It is also necessary for you to appoint a guide, as India is a miscellaneous country and if one is eager to discover India to the depth.

As we all know that India has many renowned places to visit therefore it becomes crucial for an individual to do a careful study on the internet about the destinations one is scheduling to visit. The country of India has many historic and ancient monuments and landmarks belonging to the Mughal era, so if one knows about the place in advance the travel becomes much simpler and even.

A number of religions are practiced in the country India such as Hinduism, Islam, Christianity, Sikhism, Jainism and Buddhism. So it becomes vital for one to be disciplined enough before visiting holy places as all religious institutions have there on cultural faith and belief. For example it is mandatory for a person to remove their shoes before entering a temple or a mosque. Also consumption of alcohol and smoking of cigarette is prohibited in the site of these holy places. Being a traveler one does not possess such information so at all times it is good to know about the place well in advance.

One should plan the trip well in advance in order to prevent last minute hustle bustle. During peak season all the hotels and even flights are booked well in advance so last minute arrangements can lead to chaos and may hamper the whole trip. Also you will be left with limited options when it comes to your stay in India. One should also find out about the climate as India has extreme summers as well as winters. Lastly one should fix the entire cost of the travel in order to avoid unnecessary and wasteful expenditure. These are some imperative guidelines one can remember and make use before undertaking a voyage to India.

Goa is one of the enthralling tourist spot in the country India. There are many famous tourist destinations in the world, India is one among them. Millions of people from all over the world come to holiday Indian tourism. India is a country which has exhilarating wild- life sanctuaries to name a few are Bandhavgarh National Park, Ranthambore National Park, Gir Wildlife Sanctuary, Corbett National Park and Sundarbans National Park. In India one can find beautiful beaches in the state of Maharashtra, Chennai, Kerala and Goa. Goa is one of the well-liked tourist places among the people.

There are many tourism options in India which will never dissatisfy you. One can visit the breath-taking and pleasant hill- stations such as Shimla, Nainital which has the famous Corbett National Park, Ooty, Mussourie, Mount Abu and many more hill-stations one can visit. In accumulation to the lively hill stations, there are a number of peaceful and calm environment retreats and places of significance to visit for a nature follower. If one is passionate to see Indian festivals and ethnicity than one must plan to visit the states of Rajasthan, Gujrat, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. If one is a nature lover in that case a visit to the state of Jammu and Kashmir is neccesary. Jammu is known for its charming landscapes, prehistoric temples and mosques. A trip to Dal Lake in Srinagar is a must.

In modern times, Ladakh has evolved as a foremost center for escapade tourism. This region of India is known as "moon on earth" and has marvelous mountains and subterranean gorges. In the centre of the country is the state of Madhya Pradesh also called as the Heart of India. There are numerous historic buildings, gracefully engraved temples, stupas, forts and palaces of the royal families are spotted all over the state. The world renowned temples of Khajuraho are also to be found in this state.

The Ajanta and Ellora caves in the state of Maharashtra are the two UNESCO World Heritage sites and are greatly accountable for the expansion of Indian tourism. The North-Eastern part of the country comprises of the states of Nagaland, Sikkim, Assam and Manipur. Darjeeling also recognized as Queen of hills is a most visited tourist destination here.

The state of Tamil Nadu to the south of India is the most visited tourist places when it comes to foreigners. The state has many great temples such as Madurai Meenakshi Amman Temple, Brihadeeswarar Temple, Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple. Scenic Waterfalls and National Parks are situated across the state of Tamil Nadu. The new state of Uttarakhand also called as the abode of the Gods is famed for its snow covered mountain, opaque forests, glaciers and a number of pilgrimage places such as Badrinath, Kedarnath, Gangotri and Yamunotri also called as Char-dham.

In reality, each section & province of the nation India has its own magnitude and more than a few places of tourist interest to acquire their attention. Certainly your tour to India will be an inimitable and enjoyable travel incident which will last for more than a generation to come. So definitely plan to visit the implausible and diversified India.

However the top three destinations to explore in India are Agra, Shimla and Kerala.

The city of Agra is located in the states of Uttar Pradesh on the banks of river Yamuna. The city has the world distinguished monument the Taj Mahal which was declared as a heritage place by UNESCO. It was created by noble Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in the reminiscence of his dearly loved wife Mumtaz Mahal. The Christ church which has blemished windows made of glass is planned in a unique manner which is quite distinct in style. These are some beautiful attractions one can visit in Shimla.

Kerala is a gorgeous state to the south of India and is popularly known as the God's own Country. The state of Kerala is recognized for its scenic attractiveness, majestic Wildlife sanctuaries, striking series of lakes and lagoons by the side of the Arabian Sea coast and breathtaking beaches. The Awe-inspiring Camp Wild at Faridabad

The Camp Wild is a perfect place to take a break from the daily mundane life and busy routine. It is best weekend gateway to enjoy with family and friends. The Camp Wild is situated in the state of Haryana at Dhauj in the vicinity of Mangar village in the city of Faridabad. The Camp Wild is bounded by Aravali Hills and rock climbing is one of the popular activities one can indulge in on the tough granite rocks. There are other related sports to participate in on the Aravali hills. The Aravali hills at Camp Wild have become a well known place for rock climbers.

The Camp Wild is located in the sight of village and therefore you will see a mixture of urban and farm life. One can spot various species of vibrant birds in the area. Almost sixty seven species of birds are observed here. The Camp Wild is a wonderful place to visit with family and friends, as you will not get to see such a beautiful picture of nature in the crowded cities. The Camp Wild has a resort within the area. The lodge rooms are well furnished with contemporary amenities and have all the required services available. There are only fifteen rooms in the resort, so prior reservation is important.

Buddhist places are major attractions for tourists to relish.

Leh Palace: Leh is an old and historical town and served royal capital city of the old kingdom. It is also famous for a nine storey palace built by king Singe Namgyal in the 17th century. Its architecture reflects ancient Tibetan architectural style and is situated at the base of Leh. Government of Ladakh has declared it as a heritage site. Above the palace at the Namgyal hill is the Victory Tower built in the honor of those who sacrificed their lives for Ladakh's victory over the Balti armies of Kashmir in the early 16th century.

Shanti Stupa: The stupa was constructed by Japanese Buddhist organization in 1985 to promote world peace. It is 3 km away from fort road and is located on the hilltop at Changspa. This magnificent white domed structure offers astounding views of sunrise and sunset. It looks dazzling at night time under the beautifully illuminated lights and glittering atmosphere.

Skara: Skara is a pretty and beautiful village of Leh where one can admire the earthen battlements of Zorawar Singh's forts, now housing army barracks.
